title: Authors and Citation
text: Kristen Dybala. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dybala K (2024). : Wetland Hydrological Analysis Tools. R package version 0.1.0.9000,  https://pointblue.github.io//, https://github.com/pointblue/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {WHAT: Wetland Hydrological Analysis Tools},   author = {Kristen Dybala},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0.9000,  https://pointblue.github.io/WHAT/},   url = {https://github.com/pointblue/WHAT}, }

title: Wetland Hydrological Analysis Tools
text: supports estimation wetland water management schedules California’s Central Valley analysis near-real-time, automated hydrological data Point Blue’s Water Tracker. Water Tracker uses LandSat satellite imagery detect open surface water Central Valley estimate proportion given spatial unit flooded given date. supports estimating typical maximum extent flooding individual units across multiple water years, variation timing extent flooding among water years, estimating timing water management schedules, floodup drawdown. intended application spatial units representing individual wetland management units, provides support summarizing across multiple units within larger region, Groundwater Sustainability Plan area. Known likely wetland management unit boundaries already integrated WaterTracker’s automated processing satellite imagery, facilitate application tools package, hydrological data within custom boundaries can also requested WaterTracker uploading shapefile drawing custom spatial area.

title: Wetland Hydrological Analysis Tools
text: can install development version GitHub :

title: Wetland Hydrological Analysis Tools
text: Using sample data included, estimate 95th percentile wetted area detected wetland management unit water years included: Interpolate extent flooding onto common set dates explore variation across water years (individual unit combinations units):  Interpret sequence WaterTracker observations detect monthly modes unit, optionally generalize across multiple water years estimate general wetland management schedule:
code: library(WHAT)  data(sampledat)  dat <- format_watertracker(sampledat[sampledat$WETLAND == 'SampleWetland1',]) |>    estimate_flood_extent(prob = 0.95)  dplyr::select(dat, unit, ObservedAreaWaterHa_pq) |> dplyr::distinct() #> # A tibble: 9 × 2 #>   unit                 ObservedAreaWaterHa_pq #>   <chr>                                 <dbl> #> 1 SampleWetland1_Unit1                24.8    #> 2 SampleWetland1_Unit2                 3.05   #> 3 SampleWetland1_Unit3                 0.261  #> 4 SampleWetland1_Unit4                 2.43   #> 5 SampleWetland1_Unit5                 0.285  #> 6 SampleWetland1_Unit6                 0.0564 #> 7 SampleWetland1_Unit7                36.7    #> 8 SampleWetland1_Unit8                51.0    #> 9 SampleWetland1_Unit9                 6.75 dat_interp = interpolate_flooding(   dat[dat$unit == 'SampleWetland1_Unit2',],    wateryear = c(2014, 2015, 2016, 2017),    interval = 'week')  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(dat_interp, aes(interval, AreaWater_ac)) +    geom_line() +   facet_wrap(~wateryear, ncol = 1) +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(1, 53, 4),                       labels = dat_interp$date[seq(1, 53, 4)] |> format('%b-%d')) +   labs(x = NULL, y = 'Acres Flooded') estimate_flood_delta(dat[dat$unit == 'SampleWetland1_Unit2',]) |>    estimate_wetland_mode() |>    generalize_wetland_mode() |>    dplyr::select(month_name, mode, weight) |>    print(n = 12) #> # A tibble: 12 × 3 #>    month_name mode  weight #>    <fct>      <fct>  <dbl> #>  1 Oct        F      0.636 #>  2 Nov        M      0.8   #>  3 Dec        M      1     #>  4 Jan        M      1     #>  5 Feb        M      1     #>  6 Mar        M      1     #>  7 Apr        D      0.455 #>  8 May        N      0.455 #>  9 Jun        N      0.727 #> 10 Jul        N      1     #> 11 Aug        N      1     #> 12 Sep        N      0.818

title: Wetland Hydrological Analysis Tools
text: package originally developed part project “California Central Valley Wetlands Water Budget Tool Development”, Grant . R21AP10037-00, WaterSMART (Sustain Manage America’s Resources Tomorrow) Applied Science Grant U.S. Bureau Reclamation.

title: Extract observation date details — add_date_details
text: Extract observation date details

title: Extract observation date details — add_date_details
text: df Input data frame water tracker added field "obsdate" estimate_obsdate()

title: Extract observation date details — add_date_details
text: tibble added fields "year", "month", "wateryear", "month_name".

title: Extract observation date details — add_date_details
text: Internal format_watertracker(). meant called separately.

title: Estimate change in flooding — estimate_flood_delta
text: Interprets sequence Water Tracker data unit estimate whether change extent flooding previous observation represents substantial increase decrease.

title: Estimate change in flooding — estimate_flood_delta
text: df Input tibble estimate_flood_extent(). delta Numeric proportion change representing significant increase decrease flooding.

title: Estimate change in flooding — estimate_flood_delta
text: tibble added fields: flood_delta flood_trend

title: Estimate change in flooding — estimate_flood_delta
text: unit, proportion change flooded area previous observation date calculated (flood_delta) direction magnitude change categorized (flood_trend) based input value delta provided, : INCREASE:  flood_delta >= delta : delta > flood_delta > 0 0: flood_delta = 0 : 0 > flood_delta > -delta DECREASE: -delta >= flood_delta

title: Estimate change in flooding — estimate_flood_delta
code: df = format_watertracker(sampledat) |> estimate_flood_extent() estimate_flood_delta(df) #> # A tibble: 5,474 × 25 #>    wateryear month month_name  year obsdate    unit        WETLAND CLASS AREA_HA #>        <dbl> <dbl> <fct>      <dbl> <date>     <chr>       <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> #>  1      2013     5 May         2013 2013-05-11 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  2      2013     5 May         2013 2013-05-27 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  3      2013     6 Jun         2013 2013-06-12 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  4      2013     6 Jun         2013 2013-06-28 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  5      2013     7 Jul         2013 2013-07-14 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  6      2013     7 Jul         2013 2013-07-30 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  7      2013     8 Aug         2013 2013-08-10 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  8      2013     8 Aug         2013 2013-08-19 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  9      2013     8 Aug         2013 2013-08-26 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #> 10      2013     9 Sep         2013 2013-09-04 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #> # ℹ 5,464 more rows #> # ℹ 16 more variables: AREA_AC <dbl>, Mosaic <chr>, MosaicDateStart <date>, #> #   MosaicDateEnd <date>, ObservedPixels <dbl>, WaterPixels <dbl>, #> #   ObservedAreaHa <dbl>, ObservedAreaWaterHa <dbl>, PercentObserved <dbl>, #> #   PercentWater <dbl>, ObservedAreaWaterHa_pq <dbl>, #> #   ObservedAreaWater_adjust <dbl>, flood_prop <dbl>, flood_status <chr>, #> #   flood_delta <dbl>, flood_trend <chr>

title: Estimate flooding extent — estimate_flood_extent
text: Estimates typical maximum extent open water footprint unit percentile observations dataset, helping correct upland areas may included within unit rarely, ever, flooded.

title: Estimate flooding extent — estimate_flood_extent
text: df Input tibble format_watertracker(). prob Single numeric value passed quantile(); see Details. full_prop_threshold Numeric value (0-1); see Details. wet_prop_threshold Numeric value (0-1); see Details.

title: Estimate flooding extent — estimate_flood_extent
text: tibble added fields: ObservedAreaWater_pq, ObservedAreaWater_adjust, flood_prop, flood_status

title: Estimate flooding extent — estimate_flood_extent
text: unit, calculates ObservedAreaWater_pq percentile value, determined prob, ObservedAreaWaterHa dataset (provided raw Water Tracker data). value intended represent typical upper limit wetted area, account upland areas unit typically flooded part regular management. value prob typically set less 1 allow outliers resulting occasional extreme flooding events, driven precipitation. (Note providing multiple values prob, supported quantile() function, supported function.) ObservedAreaWater_adjust calculated reflect upper limit wetted area, values ObservedAreaWaterHa exceed ObservedAreaWater_pq reduced value. Likewise, flood_prop calculated proportion observed ObservedAreaWater_adjust date relative upper limit. Finally categorical flood_status assigned observation date : full: flood_prop >= full_prop_threshold wet: wet_prop_threshold <= flood_prop < full_prop_threshold, trace: flood_prop > 0 < wet prop threshold dry: flood_prop = 0

title: Estimate flooding extent — estimate_flood_extent
code: df = format_watertracker(sampledat) estimate_flood_extent(df) #> # A tibble: 5,474 × 23 #>    wateryear month month_name  year obsdate    unit        WETLAND CLASS AREA_HA #>        <dbl> <dbl> <fct>      <dbl> <date>     <chr>       <chr>   <chr>   <dbl> #>  1      2013     5 May         2013 2013-05-11 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  2      2013     5 May         2013 2013-05-27 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  3      2013     6 Jun         2013 2013-06-12 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  4      2013     6 Jun         2013 2013-06-28 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  5      2013     7 Jul         2013 2013-07-14 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  6      2013     7 Jul         2013 2013-07-30 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  7      2013     8 Aug         2013 2013-08-10 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  8      2013     8 Aug         2013 2013-08-19 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #>  9      2013     8 Aug         2013 2013-08-26 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #> 10      2013     9 Sep         2013 2013-09-04 SampleWetl… Sample… mana…    37.1 #> # ℹ 5,464 more rows #> # ℹ 14 more variables: AREA_AC <dbl>, Mosaic <chr>, MosaicDateStart <date>, #> #   MosaicDateEnd <date>, ObservedPixels <dbl>, WaterPixels <dbl>, #> #   ObservedAreaHa <dbl>, ObservedAreaWaterHa <dbl>, PercentObserved <dbl>, #> #   PercentWater <dbl>, ObservedAreaWaterHa_pq <dbl>, #> #   ObservedAreaWater_adjust <dbl>, flood_prop <dbl>, flood_status <chr>

what: Estimate observation date of satellite imagery — estimate_obsdate
title: Estimate observation date of satellite imagery — estimate_obsdate
text: Estimate observation date satellite imagery

title: Estimate observation date of satellite imagery — estimate_obsdate
Estimate observation date of satellite imagery — estimate_obsdate
text: df Input data frame water tracker added field "dup" find_duplicates()

title: Estimate observation date of satellite imagery — estimate_obsdate
text: tibble added fields "overlap_days" "obsdate".

title: Estimate observation date of satellite imagery — estimate_obsdate
text: Internal format_watertracker(). meant called separately. Function first find number days overlap period end date observation's mosaic date range start next observation's date range. next row marked duplicate, observation date image estimated midpoint overlap period. Otherwise, observation date estimated midpoint original mosaic start end date range.

what: Estimate monthly wetland operational modes — estimate_wetland_mode
title: Estimate monthly wetland operational modes — estimate_wetland_mode
text: Interprets results estimate_flood_delta() estimate assign monthly water management modes use Wetland Water Budget Tool simple spread-sheet based tool allowing non-specialists estimate wetland water budgets combination management unit size schedule monthly operational modes.

title: Estimate monthly wetland operational modes — estimate_wetland_mode
Estimate monthly wetland operational modes — estimate_wetland_mode
text: df Input tibble estimate_flood_delta() fullmode One M H; default operational mode units considered fully flooded

title: Estimate monthly wetland operational modes — estimate_wetland_mode
text: tibble additional field "mode"

title: Estimate monthly wetland operational modes — estimate_wetland_mode
text: sequence Water Tracker observations unit analyzed interpret monthly operational mode codes, defined Wetland Water Budget Tool (WWBT): F (flood ): water applied fully flood unit M (maintenance): unit fully flooded actively maintained full compensate evapotranspiration soil infiltration H (hold): alternative maintenance mode unit () fully flooded actively maintained full; evapotranspiration soil infiltration may result declines depth D (drawdown): unit drained (irrigation): short-term flooding N (water supply): water added unit, though water may present management prior months (e.g., drawdown still progress) C (cropped): water supply, actively growing vegetation removing water soil evapotranspiration Using output estimate_flood_delta(), function first identifies months flood_status observations "full", interpreted M H depending fullmode provided, "dry", interpreted N. Months observations differ extent flooding considered transitional, interpreted examining flood_trend, direction magnitude change proportion flooded previous observation. substantial increase proportion unit flooded one observation date next interpreted new water applied unit, normally interpreted F . distinction F interpreted duration flooding detected, F requiring subsequent observation(s) interpreted M H. Exceptions include: (1) increases represent (sometimes substantial) fluctuations extent flooding extended periods M H (instead interpreted continued M H), (2) previous observation already interpreted F. one month water year normally interpreted F, even flood slow extent flooding continues increase following month. However, important note floodup may begin end previous water year (e.g., September). limit number months can interpreted , multiple irrigation events detected gaps flooding . substantial decrease proportion unit flooded one observation next interpreted D, provided previous observation(s) interpreted M H D. one month water year normally designated D, even drawdown slow still surface water present following month. previous observation already designated D extent flooding continues decline, interpreted N. Relatively small fluctuations extent flooding ignored assumed reflect noise remote sensing data. addition, WaterTracker data yet capable automatically detecting cropped status. Values N may changed manually C needed.

title: Find pseudoreplicate/duplicate data in Water Tracker output — find_duplicates
text: Internal format_watertracker(). meant called separately. observation considered likely duplicate previous observation (.e. representing individual scene) : (1) date range mosaic starts previous mosaic's end date, (2) PercentWater ObservedAreaHa stats match, (3) PercentWater either NA greater zero (difficult distinguish multiple dry images duplicates).

text: tibble added fields unit, wateryear, year, month, month_name

title: Format Water Tracker data — format_watertracker
text: unique wetland management unit, identifies removes likely pseudoreplicate data sequential observations identical values may represent image multiple mosaics. Estimates actual observation date midpoint mosaic start end dates, unless next observation likely pseudoreplicate, case date estimated midpoint overlapping date range two observations. Also recalculate PercentWater ObservedAreaWaterHa / ObservedAreaHa * 100 (ensure none >100%). Wrapper function find_duplicates(), estimate_obsdate(), add_date_details(). Expects standard output Water Tracker data fields MosaicDateStart, MosaicDateEnd, ObservedAreaHa, PercentWater.

title: Generalize monthly management modes — generalize_wetland_mode
text: df Input tibble estimate_wetland_mode() fullmode One M H; necessary clean = TRUE; see Details clean Logical; determines whether correct repeat values F D

title: Generalize monthly management modes — generalize_wetland_mode
text: Input tibble one entry month unit, frequent value "mode", additional field weight giving proportion years observed containing management mode month.

title: Generalize monthly management modes — generalize_wetland_mode
text: unit, identifies returns frequent management mode month calculates weight proportion water years mode detected. Low values weight reflect months annual variability monthly management schedules. Note ties returned, case ties, function favors returning modes following order: F, D, , M, H, N (see estimate_wetland_mode() details). therefore possible function return multiple months values F D. Setting clean=TRUE reclassify duplicate values F D fullmode, also remove weight estimates since may longer valid.

title: Interpolate flooding — interpolate_flooding
text: tibble fields: date, year, month, wateryear, AreaWater_ha, AreaWater_ac

title: Interpolate flooding — interpolate_flooding
text: unit, function interpolates values ObservedAreaWater_adjust generated form estimate_flood_extent() across desired water years. water year, sequence dates interpolate first generated Oct 1 Sep 30 desired interval. intervals weeks days leap years, leap day intentionally skipped sequence dates, facilitating comparisons across multiple years common dates. Values interpreted using zoo::na.spline(), values less zero changed zero. Optionally, sum = TRUE, summarizes across units unique date return total area flooded.
